synthesis.notes: Methyl pyropheophorbide a (1) was prepared from an extract of Spirulina pacifica.

steps.details: Methyl pyropheophorbide a (1) was oxidized to the 2-carboxaldehyde.
The 2-carboxaldehyde was converted to its oxime derivative.
The oxime derivative was further processed by zinc(II) insertion to obtain the zinc(II) pyropheophorbide derivative (2).

synthesis.temperature: Room temperature for formation; 65 °C for partial dissociation to monomers
synthesis.notes: In CHCl3, 2 formed a mutually coordinated dimeric structure (5) according to spectroscopic and other evidence. Cooling the CDCl3 solution of 5 broadened all signals, whereas warming to 65 °C partially shifted the shielded signals closer to positions expected for monomeric pyropheophorbide.

additional_reagents.purpose: To form monomeric zinc(II) pyropheophorbide by adding to the solution of 5.
To shift the signals to positions indicating monomeric 2·pyridine-d5.

synthesis.notes: Dark green crystals of 2·CHCl3 were obtained upon slow evaporation of a CHCl3 solution. In contrast to the oxime-coordinated dimeric structure 5 found in solution, a polymeric staircase structure forms in the solid state.
